pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.2: Just then Venerable Upananda the Sakyan went to the house of a friend and sat down with his wife in their bedroom.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.3: The husband approached Upananda, bowed, and sat down.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.4: He then said to his wife, “Please get him alms.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.6: Soon afterwards he said, “Please leave, Venerable; the alms have been given.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.7: But the woman, knowing that her husband was lustful, said, “Please sit, Venerable; don’t go.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.9: a third time he repeated his request,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.10: and both times his wife repeated hers.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.11: He then left the house and complained to the other monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.12: “Venerables, Venerable Upananda is seated with my wife in our bedroom.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.13: When I ask him to leave, he doesn’t want to go.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.15: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.16: “How can Venerable Upananda sit down intruding on a lustful couple?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.17: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.20: Foolish man, how can you sit down intruding on a lustful couple?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.21: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.22: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:1.23: ‘If a monk sits down intruding on a lustful couple, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a complete Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.1.6: there is both a woman and a man. The woman and the man have not both left, and both are not without sensual desire.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.1.10: in a large house, if he sits down more than one arm’s reach beyond the door frame, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.1.11: In a small house, if he sits down after going beyond the ridge beam, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.1: If it is a bedroom, and he perceives it as a bedroom, and he sits down intruding on a lustful couple, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.2: If it is a bedroom, but he is unsure if it is, and he sits down intruding on a lustful couple, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.3: If it is a bedroom, but he does not perceive it as a bedroom, and he sits down intruding on a lustful couple, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.4: If it is not a bedroom, but he perceives it as a bedroom, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.5: If it is not a bedroom, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.2.6: If it is not a bedroom, and he does not perceives it as a bedroom, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.3.2: if, in a large house, he sits down, but not beyond one arm’s reach of the door frame;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.3.3: if, in a small house, he sits down, but not beyond the ridge beam;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.3.4: if he has a companion monk;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.3.6: if both are without sensual desire;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.3.7: if it is not a bedroom;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.3.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc43:2.3.10: The third rule, the training rule on lustful, is finished.
